document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Didicrum Enderlein (Diptera, Psychodidae, Psychodinae) from Argentinean Patagonia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Didicrum Enderlein (Diptera, Psychodidae, Psychodinae) from Argentinean Patagonia

subSubSection.paragraph: Measurements . Head height 0.56 , width 0.45 ; mouthparts length (from clypeus inferior border to apex of labellum) 0.12 ; palpus length 0.56 ; antenna length 1.05 ; wing length 2.5 , width 1.10 ; epandrium length (barely visible) 0.12 ; surstylus length 0.35 , apical tenaculum length: 0.06 ; gonostylus length: 0.14 ; gonocoxite length: 0.12 ; aedeagus length: 0.11 ; basiphallus length: 0.12 , distiphallus length: 0.13 . All measurements are in mm.

Measurements . Head high: 0.50 , width: 0.46 ; mouthparts length (from clypeus inferior border to apex of labellum): 0.10 ; palpus length: 0.59 ; antenna length: 1.21 ; wing length: 3.10 , width: 1.27 ; subgenital plate length (from anterior margin to apex of hypovalve): 0.17 ; cercus length: 0.35 . All measurements in mm.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–6.
Didicrum naimae Omad
,
sp. nov .
, male (holotype). 1. Head frontal view. 2. Wing. 3. palpus. 4. scape, pedicel and first flagellomere. 5. Antenna, last 5 flagellomeres. 6-8. Male Terminalia. 6. terminalia in part showing the hypandrium, aedeagus, distiphallus, basiphallus and gonopods, both gonocoxites, one gonostylus; anterior gonocoxal apodemes. All measures in mm.

FIGURES 7–8.
Didicrum naimae Omad
,
sp. nov .
, male (holotype). 7. Terminalia in part showing the posterior margin of epandrium, tergum 10, sternum 10, cercus and the apical tenaculum. 8. Aedeagal complex in part showing the aedeagus and the distiphallus. All measures in mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined . ARGENTINA : Río Negro, Nahuel Huapi National Park, Arroyo Blanco (
40 º 39 ’ 3.4 ’’ S
,
71 º 24 ’ 45.8 ’’ W
, 822 m asl), Malaise trap,
3–21 .i. 2008
, Garré and Montes de Oca, leg.
1 ♂
( holotype ), 1 ♀,
2 ♂
( paratype ); Nahuel Huapi National Park, Río Neuquenco (
40 º 28 ’ 48.3 ’’ S
,
71 º 36 ’ 44.1 ’’ W
, 809 m asl) Malaise trap,
20 .xii. 2007
–
9 .i. 2008
, Garré and Montes de Oca, leg.
1 ♂
, 1 ♀ ( paratype ); Nahuel Huapi National Park, Río Frias (
41 º 05’ 14.8 ’’ S
,
71 º 48 ’ 20.9 ’’ W
, 765 m asl), Malaise trap,
14 – 24 .ii. 2008
, Garré and Montes de Oca, 1 ♀ ( paratype ); Chubut, Los Alerces National Park, Río Frey (
42 º 51 ’ 49.3 ’’ S
,
71 º 44 ’ 29.9 ’’ W
, 750 m asl) Hand net,
28 .xii. 2011
, Omad, leg.
1 ♂
( paratype ).

Etymology. The specific epithet
naimae
is after Naíma Omad, one of the dearest nieces of the author.
